title: runtime: sys_windows_amd64.s not setting r2 return value
body:
As discussed at [this golang-nuts post](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-nuts/phkTqppqL7I), the `runtimeÂ·asmstdcall` function for windows/amd64 uses this return code

~~~ nasm
// Return result.
POPQ	CX
MOVQ	AX, libcall_r1(CX)
~~~

while corresponding code from `runtime/sys_windows_386.s` uses

~~~ nasm
// Return result.
MOVL	fn+0(FP), BX
MOVL	AX, libcall_r1(BX)
MOVL	DX, libcall_r2(BX)
~~~

Go asm for 386 and amd64 for darwin, linux, and freebsd in `syscall/asm_*.s` all return r2 from DX like the above windows/386 snippet.
